isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING COMPRESSOR AND CLUTCH TWO CYLINDER RECIPROCATING TYPE - BEFORE 01/01/1993 (R-12) - Lubrication

svcproc.title: REFRIGERANT OIL
svcproc.para: The type of refrigerant oil used in HFC-134A charged systems has been changed to a non-mineral base oil. The following information must be adhered to when servicing air conditioning systems.

important.para: The refrigerant oil used in R-12 charged air conditioning systems CANNOT be used in HFC-134A charged air conditioning systems. The oil used in HFC-134A charged air conditioning systems CANNOT be used in R-12 charged air conditioning systems.

svcproc.para: If you put the wrong oil in the system you are servicing, the system will function poorly and the life of the compressor will be drastically reduced.

Place the compressor in mounted position. Add refrigerant oil until dipstick reading is as given in SPECIFICATIONS ( Figure 35). Use specified refrigerant oil for the system being serviced. Install remaining oil fill plug with a new O-ring gasket and tighten to 4 to 11 ft-lbs. (5 to 15 N•m).
